alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 20 at 2:45AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 3 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet is expected on west facing through this evening, then surf will subside a bit tonight and Saturday. However, there will be a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Saturday. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on exposed west facing beaches. Nuisance tidal overflow is possible in beach parking lots and walkways around the high tide early this afternoon.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
